intro: Lastrea sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
